text: Sir carbon is a smaller part.....as a whole we need to reduce ecological footprint.....we need to reduce every unnecessary things with greater footprint.....well many people can argue that in that case we need to reduce our economy to some extent or we may need to stop using some gadgets.....yeah if it is necessary for sustainability we must do it without fail....now as you are talking about Govt......yes they are responsible...no doubt for that.....but we make our Govt..... what I mean to say.....we only shout and don't reduce our daily lifestyle habits and continue to blame Govt..... It's not gonna work.....in this aspect last part of your video was nice to check food preferences for reducing carbon emissions.....but it's not only food rather everything we use daily is somehow related to carbon emissions.....why not we count steel utensils.... steel industry also produced a significant carbon in environment....and apart from it as I said earlier that carbon is a smaller aspect of ecological footprint....we need to do as a whole reduction in ecological footprint...for this we may need to reduce economy....in older times our grandparents said don't lead a exploitative lifestyle in future it's going to harm you only....well it if doesn't hurt us somehow it is surely going to hurt our future generations...if you argue that we need to go back in time when we didn't had gadgets for ease of living I will say yes it's needed if not then we are just seeing the half of the situation and overlooking the other half.....we shouldn't keep any unnecessary excessive things...As in the bigger picture everything the human society derived is just a product of the Earth and it's environment......We should live with the minimum...... that should be the mantra for new Environmental Welfare for future generations....

text:
What do you have to say about the following Dhruv?


1) Failed climate predictions
https://cei.org/blog/wrong-again-50-years-failed-eco-pocalyptic-predictions


2) Paris Climate Fraud
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=cVkAsPizAbU
 
3) At 5:28 You don't talk about other Polluters? Just Exxon Mobil? What about China (~17-18%) ? Saudi Arabia? Iran? and India
I'm suspecting some bias here. Not to mention you quote the Guardian which is a left wing garbage.


4) Cruel left wing Climate activism
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=Z7KTfPlCrgY


5) The environmental cost of renewable energy
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=psFkvOpSQc0


6) False Narratives by major media outlets on polar bear population
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=AzGxUKFqvHQ


7) Green Peace Fraud
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=UFHX526NPbE


8) Eco-anxiety caused by fear mongering and preying on children
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=-icUpEgngKQ


9) Using children (mentally ill in case of Greta Thunberg) to emotionally manipulate people to bring unsustainable policy changes.
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=IsqaPs-8SEs
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=VDNJoYrlZsI
It is so clear to see she is being used as a propaganda tool at the cost of her own mental health. You'll all drive people like her to suicide to gain some political mileage. After that you'll  double down and reinforce your narratives while pointing your fingers at climate skeptics.


10) Although Arctic ice is melting, Antarctic ice is growing. How does that effect climate change?
https://earthdata.nasa.gov/learn/sensing-our-planet/unexpected-ice


11) Failed Climate models
https://realclimatescience.com/2019/02/failed-climate-models/


12) NASA Global temperature fraud
https://realclimatescience.com/2019/08/extending-the-history-of-nasa-global-temperature-fraud/



and the list can go on. The fact is we don't know much about Climate change. Instead advancing a one-sided narrative, discussions have to go back and forth to find out possible and feasible solutions. We cannot do it at the extent of economic stagnation in India. Cleaning up our rivers would be a good start as well.

text:
Govindaaa. 
You people really think Climate change is happening only for the last 20 years. Dont you fools realize that this is another ploy to make money out of thin air by the western theocracies. Paris climate agreement never asks you to stop pollution. It asks you to pay for the pollution thats it. Earth is more than 3 billion years old and you people really believe that 200 years of industrial revolution is the cause of climate change? Do you know that the British Isles was fully covered in ice and that British Isles and Europe was connected by land which went under water 18000 years ago and that was not because of pollution. Do you know that more trees are being cut by Brazil for grazing lands for cows to export beef to Europe. No one talks about all this. Its always the RW vs LW. Modi and his chamchas versus this clown and his chamchas over here. This is the internet. You can get all information by yourself and you do NOT need an uneducated youtubing moron like this guy to explain things to you. Make your own judgement instead of a person who says what exactly you want and laughs all the way to the bank and most imporantly do you know that the Thunberg NEVER answers an off the cuff question. She never answers questions unless the journalist is known to her. If a 15 year old girl/boy becomes famous and if its not because of her/his sporting achievements, then you got to dig deeper. I think with my limited knowledge I can easily win any debate against Rathee especially if it is a debate moderated by neutrals and if questions are not given to him in advance. He is clearly reading off a script without any critical thinking. Wake up to such morons.

text:
Are you stupid , bro .  forcing the government to make a law on climate change is just procrastination of time .
Nothing will change if the people don't do something themselves . even if a law is implemented, these so called protesters will be among those people violating those themselves 
Today in India , lockdown has been implemented all over the country but still people are moving out and cases are rising ..
So this is utter stupidity to blame government for everything.
Throwing waste products on beaches , using vehicles all around the world ,etc these things we do are major factor of climate change   .
But this kid "Greta thunberg " just protests and gives speeches .
What is it gonna do ??
Nothing . not even a single person will remember her after a week or so . Nobody literally cares about this stuff.
So she should probably stop all this shouting . no one is gonna listen to her .
She should rather clean beaches or rather make people avoid the use of things that cause pollution.
For example ,  a 22 year old guy in Mumbai who runs a team called "beaches please ". 
He cleaned 3500 tones garbage over the past few years . Nobody praises him . Why so ? 
Accept the fact that we are not even concerned for this guy , rather we support a kid who just gives cool speeches and talks eye to eye with big leaders.

text:
Good evening Dhruv sir 
This is Diya Hariani and I am 15 years old , commenting from my mother's account.
I really appreciate your work and I am a big fan of yours. 
But I have a complaint regarding the diet you suggested to decrease carbon dioxide emissions. 
You suggested having non vegetarian foods like chicken or fish once in a while. 
But till we don't completely cut off eating meat .. it wouldn't make much of a difference. Not only meat ... But we have to stop drinking milk and eating milk products as a study has recently shown that dairy and meat industry might surpass the oil industry as the largest carbon emittor contributing imensely to climate change. Plus studies have shown that animal products are not even healthy for us humans. I hopefully request you to look into this and spread awareness about the idea of veganism and plant based lifestyle. 
Thank you

text: Nuclear power is the answer to climate change. Any alternative to fossil fuels should be just as reliable and capable of providing sufficient and surplus power. Solar and Wind power completely fail in this regard. People who say nuclear power is dangerous because of Chernobyl and Fukushima totally miss the point that such accidents have been rare in the long history of nuclear power plants. India has abundant reserves of Thorium which can be used in breeder reactors which can fuel the country's energy for several decades into the future until fusion reactors become a reality. The current climate change alarmism is unwarranted and is a nothing more than a fear mongering tactic.

text: Floods in India have always been an issue. More than climate change, it's an issue of poor city planning. We do not fare well with urban planning. We do not build underground drains capable of holding flood water. Our drains get clogged with mismanaged waste disposal. Climate change is definitely an issue, but do not attribute frequent floods in India to this.  When a city like Chennai or Mumbai gets flooded every year, keep in mind it's the the fault of every government involved in city planning and poor construction policies.

text:
Here's the problem: people don't want to live worse off lives, so almost every initiative you've mentioned will likely fail for that reason. And it sucks because we mean well, but we like our beef and chicken, and cars and planes, and AC's and heaters, and our gas-powered electrical grid, and all that. If we're being HONEST WITH OURSELVES, we're well past the point of changing our habits.

Simply put, we need more sophisticated solutions going forward, because all of these polluting things we criticize so much are also deeply ingrained in the lives of billions of people all across the globe, probably including yours and mine. We need more sophisticated solutions; solutions that can scale rapidly, and yes, solutions that are economically viable. To think everyone can plant trees, go vegan, throw away their cars, go solar, and bring today's industries to a halt is quite frankly, UNREASONABLE.

People are generally smarter these days, so let's work together to find practical solutions, because I agree WE ARE QUICKLY RUNNING OUT OF TIME.

Edit: Greetings to all my brothers and sisters in India, love from üá∫üá∏, üáßüáº, and üáøüá≤. We can solve this, but it'll take some serious creativity.

Make the world Greta again!!

Vegetarianism is already in India at highest percentage, specifically lacto-ovo vegetarian! If its dropping, it's really sad :( instead we should move towards veganism and make the best out of it! Western countries are using our ahimsa ideology and making huge progress already with promoting new businesses in plant-based alternatives. Progress is must even if it's 0.001%, its worth it if it's for sustainability and cruelty-free.


May we complete in actuality what Gandhi started in spirit! 
It's time go cruelty-free ethically as its never been easier ever before. I, myself shifted to vegan lifestyle this year's beginning and personally i feel it's easy and feel a huge change. When in you know WHY, how is easy :) #GoVegan #SaveThePlanet

text:
1. It is easy to shout anything about climate change for the first world country. But the irony is that their current position is the blessing of carbon fuels which they had used to meet their developmental goals in the past.
2. The first world country thinks, by providing "solar panels" to the poor coutries of africa will solve their economic problem.
3. Most of the third world countries r already suffering from their socio-economic problems. Their economy is weak and  devestated.  They dont have time and money  to purchase such fancy technology from the west.
4. The west invented technologies, they already met their goals, they r superpower now they r trying to stop third world countries by telling not to use carbon fuels, (wtf!! each n every country has right to be developed).
5. The third world countries r the dumping ground of first world countries. They sell their products n we use it. The MNC r using our country as their dumping grounds.
6. Those who talk about climate change are the person who work inside a air- conditioned room, who ride fancy supercars, travel by a plane or a car. They have never seen the struggle of the people of africa or asia.
7. At last, by shouting "how dare you" will never change the climate as it was before. Development bis a contunuous process which not only effects socio-economic-cultural aspects but also environment and our surroundings. Equal development should be the goal of our society. By blaming each other wont solve any problems.
       (N.B. i am worried as equal as u for  the climate change n its consequences. But for the third world country like india, who is still struggling to meet their goals, the uneven development;  have no option but to be dependent on carbon fuels. We need industries to meet our goals but yes we have to look after our environment also).‚úåÔ∏è

text: Hey Dhruv, I have a couple of things to say about this. It is undeniable that the earth is warming as we can feel it. Old timers in any city will say that summers are much hotter than earlier. And also, environmental pollution of the air and water are real issues. However I have a problem with your argument against the dissenters. Those who disagree are not necessarilt right wingers. You seem to have taken a few stupid responses from Modi and Trump supporters where they're making fun of Greta's appearance/character and presenting that as representative of most dissenters. That is not the case. We must consider some things. Are we sure that the recent floods are because of global warming? Havent bad and even worse floods and  hurricanes happened before? Natural disasters are so called for a reason. They're natural. There's no evidence that hurricanes and floods are more common or more severe than they were before. Also, such apocalyptic predictions have been made in the past and they didn't come true. The likes of Greta have more fear instilled in their minds than necessary. Dont get me wrong. Im not saying theres no pollution or warming or that we shouldn't do anything. But I really think citing those examples of calamities is confirmation bias, and we need to take care not to make the problem look bigger than it actually is. Peace.

text:
When you think in terms of degree change you may think it's only 2 or 3 degrees what's the big deal? As humans a normal temperature is 98.6¬∞ but make it three more degrees - 100.6¬∞ - and somethings wrong. You go to the doctor to find the cause and hopefully the cure. 
Earth too has a temperature of sorts - a range of temperatures it can deal with BUT when it's out of control even if you believe there has always been climate changes - we still have to change too: we have to consider where homes/shelters/power plants are built; where crops and live-stock are raised; protecting our aquifers and bodies of water.  To not plan for climate changes (natural or man-made) will create large migrations of people; water wars; food wars, etc. 
Goods move from country to country depending on demand then surely we can see mass migrations because of the body's demand for clean food, water, air and housing.  We must protect and not vilify and criminalize people for wanting to live. How foolish is that?

text: One of my friend was talking great things about  Greta and her protest... Also he was talking about to conducting a protest here about climate change... He told me about the planning and all... text:
I am a child with lot many dreams for my future and for the future of my coming generation who have all the rights to thrive on this beautiful planet called "EARTH". 
India stands in one of top most polluters of the world so in that case we have to take all the responsibility for the Climate Change phenomenon. We are so selfish, so greedy and so rude that we never think of the other creatures who share this planet with us. We are responsible for the next fast coming mass extinction and yet we feel as if we have all the time. 

I have some questions for the so called top leaders of the World.

1) Why no govt on this EARTH is filing a case against AIR, WATER and SOIL because they are killing thousands and millions of people everyday, everymonth, every year and evey decade.

2) Are our democracies too weak ?

3) We have so many nuclear weapons even though why dont we put these murderer called AIR, SOIL and WATER into jails.

4) A child suffering from LUNG CANCER asks her mother "Momma, I never smoked then why am I suffering from this?"  Who has enough ability to answer this innocent child? 
 Anyone has guts to face this child?

WE ARE JUST CLAPPING SINCE 1992 UN CLIMATE CHANGE SUMMIT i.e. from Severn Suzuki's speech to most recent 2019 UN i.e. Greta Thunberg's efforts.

We humans are not only affecting the life our future generations but also the lives of innocent Animals and Plants. SHAME ON HUMANS

"HUMAN have learnt everything except HUMANITY" 

I am ashamed of the govt. who are destroying The AAREY forests, the lungs of Mayanagari.
Guys, I request you to please raise your voice against Indian govt of Maharashtra.

I am ashamed because the people who taught us about the great Amrutha Devi Bishnoi and Chipko Movement, they are cutting the forests.

#Aarey  #SaveAarey  #ChipkoMovementOnceAgain #ClimateChange #SaveMotherEarth #Deforestation #LovetheNATURE #FightForInnocents

1) I don't litter any plastic waste on roads.
2) I feed animals when I see them near my house like stray dogs and cows.
3) I keep water for birds on the terrace of my house.
4) Now as I am busy with my studies and exams I am unable to go for any tree plantation drives but till grade 10 I used to participate in these activities too.

text:
¬†@Entropy Music¬† I am not sure much but this is what WHO's research says 


"Conclusions from scientific research
In the area of biological effects and medical applications of non-ionizing radiation approximately 25,000 articles have been published over the past 30 years. Despite the feeling of some people that more research needs to be done, scientific knowledge in this area is now more extensive than for most chemicals. Based on a recent in-depth review of the scientific literature, the WHO concluded that current evidence does not confirm the existence of any health consequences from exposure to low level electromagnetic fields. However, some gaps in knowledge about biological effects exist and need further research."


https://www.who.int/peh-emf/about/WhatisEMF/en/index1.html


As far as I know that the high frequency radiations ( like Gamma rays and UV rays, that too particular type of UV rays i.e. UV-B rays, you will get to know this if you have studied class 12 NCERT tectbook of biology and NCERT Physics part II of class twelve)  harmful for living beings and as networking signals use Radio waves which do not have any health related issues for living tissues (or) their affect has not yet been proven.

text:
Hi Dhruv,
today i received a call asking my favor of vote in Maharashtra Assembly Election, i asked the caller about him , he told that he is from a research organization and they are doing a survey. Then i asked that from where they got my phone number and all my personal details like name, residence and he said he got it from a database of voter list. But as i know the public voter list published by Election commission do not contain mobile number. Under the name of this type of survey, the candidates may guess the election result of a constituency and they may make strategies to turn the voter in their favor. I suggest you to give us more information on data stealing and these type of surveys. i personally think that this survey is not good for the voter and democracy as there is chance of miss use. Also let us know about rights of a voter and privacy.

text:
It's hilarious to see, people talking about pollution, GHG emissions, water scarcity, Climate change without involving Animal Agriculture which emits more GHG than pollution from all modes of transportation combined. Here are some of the statistics in Indian context:

1) Dairy Industry alone releases 31,000 crore KGs of Co2e per year (Search Enteric Fermentation of Ruminants, we have 30 crore bovine in India)

2) Indian dairy industry consumes 16 lakh crore liters of water each year to produce milk for consumption of which around more than 50% of milk is just being used for luxury of tea and coffee, if an average  indian keeps away milk products for one year, the water footprint of that milk can actually be used for 7 years of bathing every day and can quench the thirst of 70 people for a year. Same goes with poultry industry too, it takes 4350 liters of water to produce 1 KG of chicken, where as 330 liters of water to produce 1 KG of vegetables 

3)15% of all grains in India are being fed to animals, only to be killed or exploited for the same nutrients, the feed to output ratio is just 10% for calories and 25% for protein with regards to meat. 


There is no sense to support animal agriculture which is killing billions of sentient beings, destroying environment, using up resources in large numbers, time to realize the TRUTH and switch to plant based diet which is cruelty-free, sustainable and healthy

text:
Home remedies to stop Global Warming.
1- Avoid water wastages at home eg running tap while brushing teeth.
How can it help in reducing global warming?
Ans- Your water is pumped from some where-to-tanks at roof of your terrace, that needs electricity, electricity generation needs burning of Fossil fuel. 
+
The water is not wasted so the stress on water resources decreases.

2- Assist govt initiatives
Eg 
i-segregate dry and wet waste at your home before giving it to municipal collector (if he asks for segregated waste)
- 
ii- Avoid using single use plastic.
-b/c plastic contributes to greenhouse gas emissions at every stage of its lifecycle, from its production to refining and the way it is managed as a waste product

3- Get out of the trap of consumerism.
Eg Don't just but new phone because it's their in market untill you need new one.
- b/c your old phone is an electronic waste which harms the env.
Repair your old electronics.

4- Avoid wastages of electricity.
- b/c electricity generation needs Fossil fuel burning.
 
5-Use public transport, share cabs, Cycle etc
-To reduce Fossil fuel burning.

Guys , Pls add to this list and repost. Let's make this list so exhaustive that everyone of us can have at least 1 step to take ourselves.

text:
I am a fan of Dhruv Rathee and have learned a lot from his videos.  On this occasion however, he is so wrong.  Dhruv, you said that people on the right who don't believe in climate change being a problem poked fun at Greta's looks.  Please support that claim with some evidence. If all you are able to show is some maniac in his grandma's basement, then you have missed the point.  You will have to show a legitimate commentator on the right.

How many climate activists who've taken the streets all over the world would be able to answer the following questions that seem pertinent to climate change.  I know I can answer these questions and why I believe climate change alarmism is a hoax.
1. What are the greenhouse gases in the atmosphere, which one holds the highest prominence?
2. What quantity of these greenhouse gases are man made?
3. If water vapour is the greenhouse gas with the highest prominence, why is it not deemed a control knob for the climate?
4. What percentage of carbon dioxide occupies the atmosphere?
5. How much of carbon dioxide that is in the atmosphere is man made? Have CO2 levels always been steady in history if we go back to a time before the industrial revolution?
6. If carbon dioxide which is currently at 0.04% of the atmosphere, why is it more a control knob of climate than water vapour which is anywhere between 50 to 90% of the atmosphere?

Dhruv, I've got a challenge for you. Don't be dumb bro. Listen to the arguments from the other side and then feel free to challenge those arguments. You have made a video previously about logical errors.  Don't commit them yourself.

text:
I beg your pardon, but there is no climate emergency. There was 280 ppm of CO2 before industrialisation. 280 ppm is enough to block all the radiation in CO2 absorption band. Adding more would not make any difference. Its like there were already some 20 blankets put on a person. Putting another 10 will not make much difference.
To all climate activists, just ask one question : what is climate sensitivity ? The correct answer is about 1.2 degrees for every doubling of CO2. With this rate we have more than 150 years to react. 
I agree we need to act, but there is no emergency.

text: I doubt why in every climate change discussion, no words about China  are being minced out. The fact that it alone accounts for more carbon emission than US and EU combined and even in the list of top 100 companies emitting CO2, the first position being occupied by China Coal accounting >14% which is greater than many more down the list combined, can't simply be ignored. In fact, there should be global committee identifying the root causes, sources and the authorities/governments involved behind it, along with a corresponding punitive action. The simply protest against 'nobody' or the 'government' in general won't work out as some ideas are too soothing to listen but they simply disappear in the air after sometime.

text: Change starts at home, if you will start recycling and stop using plastic bags, save energy you can help this world a lot. Rather than going out on streets demanding for a change, start it at home, use solar panels, plant more trees, stop using dangerous chemicals for agriculture. Boycott all those products which are dangerous for us humans and climate. Start sharing rides and use public transit. I am saying public transit because we have electric buses here. If you are ready to make all these changes in your life only then you deserve to go out on streets and do strikes like this. There's a lot that we all can do but as i said it all starts at home, only then go protest against government

Dhruv please make a video on the study of all Indian festivals, including the fireworks used in marriages, also on New years eve, that add to the carbon emissions of this world with the exact footprint, that Greta is unaware of. How many cigarettes are being smoked in the world and what's the cumulative effect. Even the dumpyards and waste disposal practices. With a billion or more Indians we might stand in the front line to increase the footprint.

Lastly, when we all do the basics, just from India what percentage can be controlled? That should be one interesting fact finding effort that can bring awareness to the unawares.

author: D A

text:
Nothing personal but just one question? My question to everyone who are doing these protests... That how many trees have they planted lately? How many of them have stopped mixing the non decomposable waste with the decomposable waste?how many of them have stopped using single use plastic bags? How many of them have started to use water efficiently? 
These protests are not going to work Unless we start improving it on a personal level, in our own society..
Now since I am asking these questions, I myself need to answer first... And yes in less than past one year not much but I have planted six tree's, I dispose my kitchen waste separately without mixing with plastic waste, and I have have been trying to reduce using single use plastic by using cloth bag.
These protests are good but they need to be changed into actions on personal level.

text:
The problem with most of the western environment campaigners is their own lack of knowledge ,understanding  & realisation about how they themselves are causing more harm by their own ecological footprint than the developing world. Today Greta‚Äôs own countrymen have far larger ecological footprint of more than 4.5 earths a little less than an American citizen at 5, that is if the whole world consumes our planet‚Äôs resources like a swedish then we would need 4.5 earths unlike an Indian‚Äôs 0.7 earths. A dog in Sweden has more ecological footprint than an urban Indian. 
And the focus on carbon emissions of cars and industries is completely ignoring the largest share of greenhouse emissions from Animal agricultural and our consumption of dairy & meat thru it. If all those millions who protested reduce their own Ecological footprint by becoming vegan that might be the first step towards making the Govts listen. 
How many of them can stop eating cheese, paneer, eggs, meat and milk in the immediate future ? How many of them can take an oath that they will never holiday on a Cruise ship ever ? How many of them can refuse to vote Political parties as incumbent Governments who take decisions to remove forests for mining & infrastructure projects ? How many of them can raise voice against the Governments who sanction & fund polluting power projects despite of alternatives available at the same cost ?

Whatever Dhruv said about boycotting non-veg is nothing but nonsense, this won't change anything.

Animals impact on climate: Animals like pigs, cows, buffaloes, lamb or goat release gases like Carbon dioxide, methane & Nitrous Oxide, which are greenhouse gases. These greenhouse gases traps the sunlight and the Earth gets warm. 

It's not the people who eat non-veg but the Animals who are the producers of these greenhouse gases

text: I'm disappointed that you never talked about the dairy industry and the importance of quitting dairy products. India is one of the largest exporters of beef and this is mainly because we have to fulfil the dairy needs of 1.3 billion Indians. In the process, we have grown unnatural number of animals to satiate our tastebuds with adverse affects to the nature, much worse than all the carbon emissions put together by burning of fossil fuels. Dairy is a cruel industry where cows are raped and their calves denied of their birthright food. Watch Cowspiracy here in YouTube to know the truth the world is hiding. Environmentalists can never claim to be activists until they themselves have switched to veganism. I wish you had thrown light on this as well @dhruvrathee. Talking about beef consumption alone isn't enough, one has to go to the root to decimate the problem.

author: Dhruv Rathee

text: ¬†@Dhruv Rathee¬† I disagree that the alternative sources of protein are rare in India(Lentils, Pulses are part of our diet since ages). Besides, protein in diet is overrated(Protein deficiency is unlike say a vitamin deficiency) & studies have proven adverse effects of milk in our diet(lactose intolerance for instance). Ultimately, the modern milk industry is the fodder for beef industry & supporting it is equivalent to increased animal agriculture with huge amounts of methane released into the atmosphere. We all can start somewhere by cutting down dairy & contributing to the environment. I would really like to see a video made on this topic because you have the reach to inform a large section of the society on the realities of the dairy industry & its impact :)

text:
Thank you for bringing up the diet change. A lot of so called 'environmentalists' simply ignore this solution because they don't want to go through any personal inconveniences, but would rather point fingers at corporations. We need to look within ourselves, and implement the solutions as far as we can. 
1. go vegan/vegetarian
2. Use public transport/take as less flights as we can
3. stop using single-use plastics
4. compost our wetwaste
5. plant more trees
6. be part of protests 
7. Vote for better policymakers and politicians.

text:
Individual awareness is very important
By only planting trees things are not going to change
Some scientists believe that feedback cycles have been activated
Only two ways remain now
1. Every individual needs to forsake their convenience to some extent in order to keep the carbon emission less than 2 ton per head per year. According to UN if we even manage to minimise carbon emissions 2 ton per head per year within the year 2050, the avg temperature will still rise upto 2 degrees and that will be catastrophic. A tree can absorb 1-2 ton of carbon dioxide in 40 years and on the other hand a resident of USA, Australia etc emits 16 tons of carbon per year, see the difference... How many trees will you plant and how many will live upto 40 to absorb 1 ton of carbon. We can't just leave this upto the government to fix the issue, its clearly not in their hand, its is us who can make a difference, if we don't forsake our convenience now the each species of this planet including the human race will cease to exist. And that's not even too far it may happen some decades, we may witness this in pur lifetime. Carbon emission is increasingly increasing every year and sadly other developing countries also desire to have the convenience like developed countries like USA.
2. The other option is half the population should not bring any new life to the planet. Less humans will emit less carbon.

If we don't do what we cannot do it is alright, but if we don't do what we can do we certainly are the destroyer of this beautiful creation of god our planetüåé
It is high time guys
Spread the awareness all around
Once the feedback cycle starts the temperature will only increase and there will be nothing for us to do
Do something before it is too late.
#Save_Our_Species_Save_Our_Planet

text:
Climate change
Quite often in conferences, people bring dramatists to present their thoughts emotionally loaded with words of threats and indecency which ignites collective demonstrations with a crime in it; destroying public property, private cars, and killing of people. When the law gets broken violence and killing aggravates. Look into the history of any country; communal riots get ignited by words of emotion and innocent people get killed; mischievous gets the opportunity to get satisfaction; their traits call for. When we get into emotions; we cannot think rationally, and we become violent; domestic violence is an example. Good children never blame their parents that they did nothing for them; good students study. 
Hon Prime Minister Scott Morrison is right that children should be in the classrooms studying rather get influenced by the dramatists; even dramatists don‚Äôt know that with their demonstrations they cannot change the climate. People who live near the edge of the shore should not be living there; there are flood-prone regions in Australia as well. So location is important where you put your residence. People sleep better in peaceful countries and peaceful residence. Public transport is part of policy overcome traffic congestion. Policymakers shall keep bringing changes in the ways we live. When did we first think that we do not need polythene bags? Dr Baljit Singh 29th September 2019

text: Whenever there is so called "Right wing" governments comes into existence because of populist support then these kind of things happen naturally with the help of all the liberal base by highlighting climate change as driver for human race to extinct. But they always fails to give valid explanation when questioned them "There have been numerous instances when climate change happened before also, lets say few 1000 years back when you look at Harappa, MohenjoDaro, Sumerian civilization you will get evidences. Once Africa was green from Libya to Somalia, but in a span of 1000 years it all changed, did humans caused environment changes then? were there not enough trees then? How it happened then? There are so called climate scientist who are now deprived of American Dollars which they used to get abundantly for their Climate change solution experiments which never gave any results but only filling up pockets of these scientist who reports to UN in a very horrific way about looming cataclysm of environment in epic proportions, There are various reasons involved for climate change apart from human caused pollution, like rotation of earth, and movements in its plates due to gravity, solar cycles, moon's gravity which make sea movements like ebb and flow (oceanic current), too much salination (Ex. dead sea) and desalination (which causes el nino and el nina effects) to name a few. if you research some what on global cycle of climate changes we are in the phase of climate change which is eminent between next 30-100 years, there are already many years overdue according to some research for Polar shift, but recent finding that North Pole is moving which is evident that next climate change is nearby, whether human stop eating and drinking no matter what, this change happens, human can only witness it but cannot control the nature as whole, there are already some nations going under water in few more years as well as some famous coastlines and cities (for Ex. Jakartha is sinking and Indonesia changing capital to East Kalimantan) But Liberals forget all things when they in power about same nature and join protests when they are not in power. Question is, Why not a single known liberandu supporting "Save Kaveri River Movement"? by planting billion trees near its banks, just because it was started by Sadguru? who is known Right wing philosopher? actually he is no right wing or left wing, but appreciated Modi's work on Swatch Bharath and then on-wards he become enemy of liberals. Bottom line is, Whether you join climate change protest against current governments or you plant tree or you only take care of your day to day job and leave all politics aside, this climate will not stop changing. Because "Change" is the only Constant in this world. everything changes from time to time, even our genes, our habits, perspective looking at things, maturity, education and experience, likewise nature also changes, it won't be same every-time. if Dinosaurs experienced climate change before they extinct in asteroid impact and then resulting climate change where global temperature got several degree lower for hundreds of years and loss of vegetation thus causing lose of animal life, same thing may happen in future also since we do not have any means to protect ourselves against unknown asteroid impact, and added to it, there is Planet Nine theory now taking horrific turn in the name of black hole. So, if you do some research you will only start to worry about yourself and your family and people nearby known to you and nothing else. Greta is Liberal the way she met with Obama and hates Trump. She should act like Kim Kardashian,  when Kim openly acknowledge that she didn't vote Trump, but still went with some complaints about releasing a woman who has been given too much sentence for unknowingly trafficking drug and also for Prison reforms for Black Americans, she has done it by conveying complaints, why Greta didn't done it? do some research you find out her sponsors one by one and rest is evident to you.  Have a nice day.

text:
Think like Singapore. 

1. Establish new parks and jungle in cities
2. Utilise every space for plants and trees.
3. Put high taxes on private vehicles 
4. Establish best public transport system
5. Make some stringent laws against environment (Air, water, noise, birds, animal & wild life protection) and every living being and non-living being protection.

People of India

1. Give 5% income tax rebate if anyone establish 5 trees and take care for it 1 year.

2. Give severe punishment for cutting trees, if anyone do so then he/she should bound to grow 50 trees and take care of them till 1 year.

2. Establish trees near river & sea shore but in circle formation not single line up to 1/2 sq yards. For six months every individual take responsibility to take care of them from animals, floods, put manure, etc.

3. Our government is growing crore of  trees but in wrong directions and no one can take after it. 

4. We should utilise our urban small spaces(road sides, dividers, crossings, bridges, by pass, etc.) for growing tree/plants. 

5. Make it mandatory to grow 5 plants per person; government should provide free manure, insecticides and pesticides and do monthly check. I hope it will give work to poor Gardner/people and help our domestic animals (cow, buffalo, horses, goat, sheep‚Äôs, camels, etc.) from entering butcheries and poor people can use their waste, also use household wet garbage and plants/ trees garbage for preparing organic manure selling to government on reasonable prices. This can give income to our poor villagers.

Lastly it is chain reaction if we respect & take care every living and non-living being then it will conserve us for long period of time.

text: The meat and dairy industry go hand in hand. The byproduct of the diary industry is veal and beef. As long as there's a market for the diary industry, the meat industry will produce massive amounts of beef. Dairy cows are impregnated all throughout their reproductive life in order for them to produce milk. Male calves that are born are immediately sent for salughter for veal production. Female calves are raised to become dairy cows. India is the second largest exporter of beef  after Brazil (on of the reasons the Amazon rainforest is being cleared is to make land available for cattle rearing). Consumption of milk and milk products must be reduced and preferably stopped to reduce our carbon footprint.

text:
Facts to ponder.. According to Algore, we all should have been dead by now. In fact dead long ago. But.. We're still here. In 2007 he predicted that the sea ice would be completely gone by 2013. But they're very much there. He also predicted that the global sea levels would have risen 20 feet by now. But sea level are pretty much the same. He claimed that climate change is killing the polar bears.  But in fact the polar bear population has increased by more than 50%. Biologist George Wall said in the 1970's that civilization would cease to exist within 15 or 30 years. But we're all still here. Paul Elrich claimed that by 2000s, majority of the world would be in a famine, which never happened. Ecologist Kenneth Watt predicted that we would be in an irreversible Ice Age by the advent of the millennium and the world would have run out of crude oil. Nothing like that has happened. 
Also the Vastok experiment has proved that man made climate change is a scam. 

Climate change propaganda is a lie.  It's all about the government's attempt to politicize the issue and take control over human lives.
Example : Swach Bharath tax.  Just a scam to squeeze more out of the common man. While Bharat has remained as dirty as ever.

text: Amazing video Dhruv. But you made a mistake in your analysis. Vegetarian diet would be useful, but not completely effective unless you move to vegan diet. In India(or elsewhere), vegetarians create a heavy demand for dairy products for which cows have to be raised. Which means more methane emission(30 times more potent than carbon-dioxide), more land(trees have to be felled) has to be cleared to produce their food. So the message is, if you care for environment, go for vegan diet; vegetarians are not less responsible for the mess we are in. Peace!

author: vsaluki R

text: Z3U5 LOL.  Your article sounds like guessing propaganda.  There is no such thing as too much carbon.  The molecules that plants build have the right amount of everything as is determined by their DNA.  When the Cell builds it builds according to what the DNA tells it to build.  If there is too much of something it doesn't use it.  If there is too little of something it cannot build the proteins and carbohydrates that it wants to build.  If there is a shortage of CO2 it cannot build hydrocarbons.  If there is too much CO2 it only builds what it needs.  Regarding the other chemicals that it needs, if it doesn't have them then it doesn't build the molecules that use them.  It doesn't simply build the molecules out of carbon instead.  That is impossible.  The fakes who wrote your article are pretending that there is some magical balance where just the right amount of everything was present before mankind messed it up.  This is false.  The earth atmosphere had a shortage of CO2 that severely limited plant growth.  Also, concerning nitrogen, many plants that need it can get it from the atmosphere.  This is called Nitrogen fixing.  Those that cannot get it must get it from the ground.  If there is not enough nitrogen in the ground, then farmers will add nitrogen fertilizer.  Unlike your article's fake experiment, then, the C02 will come from the atmosphere and the nitrogen will come from the fertilizer.  But considering the increase in forest growth we are seeing, most trees are finding plenty of the other elements that they need in the soil.

text: I Am Aman Temperature increase is 1C in the last 100 years.  Sea level rise is 3 inches in the last 100 years.  The effect of CO2 on global temperature is logarithmic - meaning that there will be no acceleration and there will likely be a deceleration.  NASA satellite data shows that we have increased new leaf forest growth by an area equal to two times the US in the last 35 years. And you are not seeing a thing.  What you think you see is what the Marxist media is selectively telling you about so that you will be a little sheep and give up all your freedom.  And this idiotic idea of "suffering human beings" is beyond absurd.  Look at data instead of TV for a change. Humanity has increased it's average life span by 30 years in the last 150 years.  Much of that was made possible by modern societies powered by fossil fuel.  https://www.nasa.gov/feature/goddard/2016/carbon-dioxide-fertilization-greening-earth
author: vsaluki R

text: SHASHANK YADU Well, microbrain, most of your rant has nothing to do with climate change.  What does UV have to do with anything? It certainly has nothing to do with climate change.  If cities in India are polluted, then clean them.  Again, it has nothing to do with climate change.  Concerning population growth, go cry to Africa.  Subsaharan African women are having 4.6 babies per woman on average.  White European women are having 1.6 babies per woman on average and that is below the replacement level.  What are you doing to reduce the birth rate of those African women?  Do you see Greta in Africa protesting their birth rate.  Now, regarding sea level rise, the sea levels have risen about 3 inches in the last 100 years.  Since the last ice age sea levels have risen 370 feet.  Amazon Forrest fires have always been a problem.  It is only now that a conservative is in power that the Marxist media has decided to make an issue of it.  The temperature has risen about 1C in the last 100 years.  Neither sea level rise or temperature rise is large enough to be dangerous.  And the logarithmic effect of CO2 on global temperature means that they will not become dangerous.  Basically you are confusing common pollution problems with climate change problems.  There simply is no climate change emergency.  And Greta babbling about an extinction event is pure idiocy.  But if you think that India is polluted and needs to be cleaned up, then get started.  Who is stopping you?

text:
Your suggestions to individual actions -----
1.  Plant more trees 
Reality --- People who are living in cities has no place to plant trees. Neither they have time. Nor they have the mental energy to do anything after they have finished their 60 hrs per week jobs in india ( including the travel time )

2. Limiting packaging
Reality--- Recycling cardboard  packages have been there for the last 20 years or so ..... and it will only increase. As its a viable and profitable business. So all thats need to be done is for the companies to buy recycled cardboard boxes. 

3. Do not use car. Use only shared conveyance. 
Reality ----- The buses and local trains which are available  in India are so overburdened by the population  pressure that it feels that death is better than travelling in them. To live with dignity as a human being .... everyone is opting for their personal vehicle. 

4. Carbon footprint of what you eat ( lamb bad..beef bad.. daal good)
Reality --- No human beings only eat meat all the days of the week. Specially Indians. Most of the people on this planet have a stable diet. Mostly carb, vegetables, plant protein and then 15% to 20% animal protein. And on top of that no one person eats one beef. One animal is shared by many. 


Wheres the real carbon footprint by individuals  lies in 

1) Extravagant material collections ( Dresses, shoes, watches, makeup ) !!!!
2) Lack of education on water preservation ( Individually water harvesting is the easiest thing to do ). 
3) Taking more than 1 child .
4) Wasting natural material to use in interiors of home where it is not neccessary ( Eg - Teak, Mahagony ,  Granite, Marble ) !!

Wah saab wah !! Ap bhi kya khel dikhaye !!!

text:
Completely agree with Greta and other climate activists about the changes that we need to make in our lifestyle, but the root of the problem is the sheer greed ('eternal economic growth') that has been driving companies after companies in cahoots with governments across the globe from making emends to the way in which they function!

In short, considering the current situation in our country and the world over, clearly evident is  a lack of compunction and a feel of spiritual and moral bankruptcy that keeps people from showing concern for nature and our fellow creatures!

The irony of ironies is that, quite a few countries across the world now have conservative governments in power that have a leaning towards religion and spirituality,  yet are either mute spectators in the face of atrocities or are themselves perpetrators of crimes and human right violations!

How do you expect companies and governments to show concern for nature and environment, when fellow humans are ill treated and their rights violated?

If one were to truly love the Creator in the truest sense, then it is only natural to love and care for the work of His hands: His creation!

"Indeed the love of money is the root of every evil, and in their greed some have wandered away from the faith, bringing on themselves afflictions of every kind." ------ 1 Timothy 6:10 (The New Community Bible).

first of all climate change is real and its happening right now, the people who don't believe the climate change they need to get their shit together and educate themselves.

, the subject which is still debated is how much influence does human induced activities have  on the climate and what can we do now. text: The man protest is about the Paris Climate Agreement and America's withdrawal from it. According to EPA chief Scott Pruitt, China and India signed the agreement without being forced to reduce their greenhouse emissions. Under the guidelines of the program, each nation can independently decide how to reduce emissions. Other aspects of the accord are non-binding, so there‚Äôs really no way to ensure they are enforced. So the agreement is a double edged sword. Can India handle shutting down all coal plant by 2030?

text:
Simple.... 
Bamboo toothbrush is eco-friendly. 
So, should I use it? Yes.
 Can I afford it? No.
 So, should I not brush? Nah. I need to. 
You're rich. Can you afford a bamboo toothbrush? Yes. Then should you use it? Ideally yes. 
Should you advise me about it? You may. 
Can you force me? Nah. 
But, what if you want me to use it too? Give me at cheaper rates as I can't afford.
But, you want everyone to use it. But, everybody isn't rich as of now. So, they're depending on a plastic toothbrush that they can afford right now. 
You used a plastic brush when you'd no money. Somehow (we know how) you became rich and started using bamboo brush. Now, you suddenly care for the world as all your needs have been satisfied. So, you promote it. 
Well, that's not a fair deal.
Climate change exists. But, so does paranoia about it. Rather than forcing the governments and corporates to do everything, nothing is being done at the individual level. They're working on options. Innovations are coming. But, it will take time. I cannot wait. I've already missed three waves of industrialisation because I was your slave.  
All the options of sustainable development are expensive and unaffordable for most part of the world. If those who have climbed the ladder already, and can cut down on their 'needs' and let others progress, it will be a good and fair deal. But, that's very utopian. 
Also, using kids.... I am not against it. Do it. Just that I am able to understand that it's a propaganda. Sorry, I'm not very innocent. So, I don't want to give sympathy to any crying kid.

text: I am your supporter; But Climate Change is something I am skeptical about. In 100 years temperature has increased by 1 deg. Regarding your point about floods. Its because of unplanned development with no planning for Sewer systems and managing flood water. No plans for wetland and planning for flood water passage.. Weathers are always unpredictable. It doesn't follow the same pattern. Greta travels to US using Carbon neutral ship for two weeks. Just imagine what will happen if everyone is forced to do so there will be mass collapse of industries that generate employment. Everything will be expensive.  Already unemployment rates are high everywhere in developing world due to automation.   Fact is the population dividend of 10-15 years ago is now turning into huge liability and talking about moving to expensive solar power and wind and EV is going to cause huge job losses as compared to some job gains.  Remember 2008 PEAK OIL predictions.  These GLOOM and DOOM predictions are not going to help anybody. They have to be gradual to protect the vulnerable.

I'm suspecting some bias here. Not to mention you quote the Guardian which is a left wing garbage.


4) Cruel left wing Climate activism
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=Z7KTfPlCrgY


5) The environmental cost of renewable energy
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=psFkvOpSQc0


6) False Narratives by major media outlets on polar bear population
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=AzGxUKFqvHQ


7) Green Peace Fraud
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=UFHX526NPbE


8) Eco-anxiety caused by fear mongering and preying on children
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=-icUpEgngKQ


9) Using children (mentally ill in case of Greta Thunberg) to emotionally manipulate people to bring unsustainable policy changes.
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=IsqaPs-8SEs
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=VDNJoYrlZsI
It is so clear to see she is being used as a propaganda tool at the cost of her own mental health. You'll all drive people like her to suicide to gain some political mileage. After that you'll  double down and reinforce your narratives while pointing your fingers at climate skeptics.


10) Although Arctic ice is melting, Antarctic ice is growing. How does that effect climate change?
https://earthdata.nasa.gov/learn/sensing-our-planet/unexpected-ice


11) Failed Climate models
https://realclimatescience.com/2019/02/failed-climate-models/


12) NASA Global temperature fraud
https://realclimatescience.com/2019/08/extending-the-history-of-nasa-global-temperature-fraud/



and the list can go on. The fact is we don't know much about Climate change. Instead advancing a one-sided narrative, discussions have to go back and forth to find out possible and feasible solutions. We cannot do it at the extent of economic stagnation in India. Cleaning up our rivers would be a good start as well.

text: Climate Change is happening and if we don‚Äôt take step now then we have to face the consequences in near future. Greta is doing great, I do respect her a lot..but one thing I don‚Äôt get is, why protest and make things more complicated..why to wait until government takes action, cars and bikes are used by public itself so cant they self actualise the situation instead of protest? I see students using cardboard..papers for making charts..is it really necessary? I‚Äôm sure that chart paper and cardboards can be seen laying around road or dustbin after the protest. Also I‚Äôm 100% sure majority of the people who are attends protest use personal vehicle or public transport, like really? Also protest promotes land and sound pollution..large number of recipients, results to road blockage and traffic which increase carbon emissions even more. If you really are concern then use your brain and be the change..don‚Äôt wait for the government to take the action! All this protest thing doesn‚Äôt really make sense to me..as all these huge companies who causes carbon emissions, work as per our demand.

author: Science Study media

text:
I'm unable to understand actually. "Carbon Emissions" is spread by the companies/industries. Companies are set up for the ever-increasing human needs (oil, petro-chemical, agro). Ever-increasing human needs are the result of the population explosion caused by us. So what can the Govt possibly do?

Also, a very recent case. I think in AP, a certain area of forest land was cleared. NMDC was taking up this area for mining purposes. Mining for what? For ever increasing energy/material needs. 
If they don't mine, the minerals will have to be imported from outside, that will cause the cost to grow up, and the Govt will be blamed then. 

I mean, I'm definitely not supporting the Govt. I'm not even a supporter of BJP. But, all over the world, can the Govt do anything? 

It is easy to ask the Govt to do something because as humans, we feel in a comfortable zone when we ask others to do the job, which is supposed to be done by us. 

Temperature is rising. But that is a direct result of technology improvement and energy needs. All of this, because we want our respective countries to be ahead in the technological growth. If the Govt doesn't support technological advancement, it is us who will ponder over our National Growth. 

Please try and understand that it is us ONLY who can get a change. New phones come out every now and then. Is it necessary for you to purchase a new phone? New vehicles come out every second day. Is it necessary for you to purchase them? I understand that older vehicles spread more of pollution, but if within the limits of Pollution Control Board, why change vehicles? 

It is us, the consumer who wishes to live lavishly and we then end up blaming the Govt. Rich people cannot live a second without ACs in their workplace (in most cases) and their homes. 

I see so many workmen driving solo to their office. Isn't it us who doesn't wish to carpool? Isn't it us who doesn't want to purchase newer cars? Isn't it us who wants 24x7 electricity? 

It is very easy to blame others. It is very easy to come down on roads and spend a Friday protesting. But what are we protesting about? Will we also not protest when the Govt decides to cut down electricity from 24x7 to 12x7. We will then come down on every Mondays to protest.

I'm not supporting any Govt. I'm not even for BJP. But we really need to think about this.

text:
Only the fickle minded will plant a sapling and walk home, quite content with their frivolity!

However, the good part is that most of us who are concerned about the environment, and exercise  planting trees, would engage in planting multiple saplings whenever and wherever possible.

Granted that large companies including fossil fuel ones fund massive plantation sprees, yet the cumulative effect of individuals across villages, towns, cities, metros in our country as well as countries across the world will contribute to amelioration in environmental degradation and air toxicity! Absolutely no doubts about that!

text:
¬†@Pradeep Kumar Bharti¬† It is not only about her speech. The objective of their protest is to urge the world leaders to declare Climate Emergency. 
What is Climate Eemergency?. That refer to a revolutionary change such as net zero emission by a certain date (UK followed it), lifestyle changes(public transit system), encouraging renewable energies and biotechnologies. In nut shell Climate Emergency will focus on mitigation policies than to adaptation. 
You are adhered to her speech however you ignored the the objective.

I know our country is undergoing huge economical setbacks such slowdown, jobless growth, agricultural and industrial unrest, low private investment and social setbacks such as exploding population, various inequalities and so on

STILL I keep my emphasis on climate change which had largely been overlooked by many. 

Of course we need to strike a balance between development and sustainability however we are exploitating 25% more than the capacity of Earth to replenish.

text:
There are 7 industries that are responsible for 88% of global warming -
1) Fossil Fuel Industries, (along with military industrial complex)
2) Meat and Dairy Farming, (destruction of habitats, palm oil facilitation, rainforests etc.)
3) Automobiles
4) Airlines
5) Traditional Methodology for Electrical Power Generation and Distribution (Coal, Thermal)
6) Plastics
7) Electronics (mining for rare minerals and destruction of habitat, considered under WEEE protocols of COP21).

Individual Actions albeit important, cannot alone change the centuries old entrenchment of the industrial revolution and our reliance on the industries noted above. 

As an eg..Edison wanted to use all profits from LV  electrical regeneration to fund solar and wind energy. 

Protests bring those responsible and managing the above industries to be held accountable. It holds governments who give tenders, using tax payers money, to the above industries accountable and pressurise them into looking for alternative sources of energy. 

Greta acted like the spotlight, it's upto us to carry it forward. 

Along with the Chipko movement, we need to make sure our countries go above and beyond the COP21 targets or my generation will never feel morally correct about bringing children into this planet.

Over the last two decades, the Earth has seen an increase in foliage around the planet, measured in average leaf area per year on plants and trees. Data from NASA satellites shows that China and India are leading the increase in greening on land. The effect stems mainly from ambitious tree planting programs in China and intensive agriculture in both countries.
Credits: NASA Earth Observatory

text:
Environment protection and economic development can't go hand in hand. That's the dilemma policy makers are facing today. I left a company who was involved in such malpractices. Couldn't find a job in a sustainable company for a year. Took a hit on career and package. It all comes down to numbers and money. No one is really concerned. Almost every other company is somehow contributing  in environmental contribution. Talk about pharma, oil companies, automobiles, textiles,even environmental vanguard NGOs. We have to chose  between GDP and environment. Talk about YouTube, the enormous data it is handling on it's servers, the carbon emissions due to mobile companies, the workforce, the, servers, the mobiles.. there is no escape.. 
But
We should not lose hope.

text:
Dhruv, even chicken can't be eaten. If you feed chicken 9 calories of energy, then it will generate 1 calorie of energy  apart from this, 1 kg of chicken or meat requires more than 4300 Litres of water which can't be recycled. To generate 1g of protein from chicken, it requires 34 litres of water, while for the same amount of protein, pulses require 19 Litres of water.
Nobody is forcing vegetarianism on people or infringing their right to choice of food stuff, but an understanding approach to save our planet is the need of the hour.

text:
Don't think all these will achieve anything useful. Of course shouting can add to noise pollution. Don't you remember we bought in bharat stage 1 somewhere in 1998?. Unleaded petrol and all. But did pollution came down. Bs2 bs3 bar all ?. 
Emissions and pollution will increase if human population increase. That is simple. Pollution will ultimately increase disasters and that will reduce population. Also food will become non available and that will reduce population. More towns and roads will result in more people concentrating in small areas again increase pollution. It is all simple. Eating more veg means destroying nature further with more cultivation. Just eat what is available around in your area. Stop food businesses. And well greed .... We read a lot about Delhi's traffic pollution. But has anyone measured the pollution caused by burning thousands of tonnes of fuel called ATF in the airport?. Now ATF is mainly matha and kerosene right?. üòäüòä. So all this ads are just find the easy target. We are also seeing ads saying dispose plastic bottles . Has anyone asked why soft drinks are packed in plastic bottles only. In my childhood coca cola and fanta and all came in glass bottles. Glass is easier to reuse. So why did it stop?.

text: Climate change is real. I cry everytime I hear Greta's speech. It's scary to think that people are making fun of something this serious. 10 years ago, the night sky used to be full of stars and now when I look up, I see nothing but muddy black sky. We are destroying our planet. Actually, the earth will recover itself but we humans will have to face the consequences of our own ignorance. The earth will take revenge from us. We are dying and we will die. When Greta said that we are going to face mass extinction, I had goosebumps. We all know that this is true. I don't know why people are ignoring this fact. Being able to witness the effects of climate change, I stand with Greta. If she cried during her speech, that was totally natural. Ever since I started to look into the night sky, I feel a strong connection with the nature. I guess she also feels connected to the nature that's why she shivered while talking. Everyone should feel this connection. The people who feel this connection can never make fun of Greta.

author: PUBG Legends

text:
Some of the living Legends of India :

1. Saalumarada Thimmakka from Karnataka. She is Known as Mother of trees or ‚ÄòVriksha Mathe‚Äô.

2. Jadav Payeng from Assam. He's known as Forest Man of India. 

3. Ramaiah Daripalli from Telangana, The man who planted more than 1 Crore trees. 

I am not opposing Greta Thunberg, She's doing great & also an inspiration. No doubt about it but Why should i look 16 years old girl views when my Nation have 9 years old Elangbam Valentina Devi from Manipur who found that two saplings that she planted near her house, which had grown into trees, were lopped off to widen a road. She cried inconsolably. She said I felt like I lost my 2 brothers. 
Now, Manipur CM made her ambassador for Green mission. I can learn from her views.

Why should i copy other initiatives when people of my Nation are creating Model. Like: The villagers of Rajasthan's Piplantri plants 111 trees every time a girl child is born.

text: As someone with geology background, one thing I can assure all of you. We can't stop global warming only by planting  trees. It's too late and much worse to tackle by that. If we want to drastically bring down global average temperature, we need technical research primarily focused to lower ocean surface temperatures. Whoever is in college in engineering background, I beg you to focus your efforts on projects and research that could solve this problem. Oceanographers and engineers have to come together to find a solution for this asap

text: Ok...guys, I'm not telling anyone to stop planting trees. By all means plant as many trees as possible and sustainable mixed timber forestry is very much needed. But my point is, that alone is not going to slow down global warming quick enough to not cause irreversible damage. There are much more we can do. If you guys are interested look into Carbon sequestration in oceans which is one way to lower ocean surface temperature by lowering dissolved CO2 in ocean. Building more Coral reef systems, encouraging large scale farming of marine shellfish, increasing marine flora like seaweed...these  can all help. But none of this will be ENOUGH WITHOUT significant lowering of ocean surface temperatures very quickly.
author: Aleena Prasannan

text: Decreasing ocean water temperature is more about decreasing the global temperature than about preventing further damage. Remember, we have already done great damage and we need more technical intervention into FIXING WHAT ACTUALLY WENT WRONG. Start with the ocean- water has more heat capacity- warmer ocean- warmer planet- extreme storms

The place you were born was a forest, place you may have studied was a forest, the farm where you got food was a forest, the factory from where you got anything was a forest, all civilizations were and are based near rivers and forest. These are the necessities and are required for basic life and progress. If you want to support the nature buy a land and plant a tree but you can't stop development and progress because if you don't do it others or future generation will. 
It's is easy to make a comment and make stupid petition from a room in nice AC Rooms with all the comfort. Better work on ground create a change then come to comment.
